original: Dīgha Nikāya 25
analyzed: dīgha nikāya
translated: Long Discourses

original: Udumbarikasutta
analyzed: udumbarika sutta
translated: With Udāyī

original: 1. Nigrodhaparibbājakavatthu
analyzed: nigrodha paribbājaka vatthu
translated: The account of the wanderer Nigrodha

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate
translated: Once the Lord was staying at Rājagaha, at the Vultures’ Peak.

original: Tena kho pana samayena nigrodho paribbājako udumbarikāya paribbājakārāme paṭivasati mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṁ tiṁsamattehi paribbājakasatehi.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena nigrodhaḥ paribbājakaḥ udumbarikāya paribbājaka ārāme paṭivasati mahatiyā paribbājaka parisāya saddhim tisa mattehi paribbājaka satehi
translated: And at that time the wanderer Nigrodha was staying in the Wanderers’ Park of the Single White-lotus Mango Tree with a large company of three hundred and fifty wanderers.

original: Atha kho sandhāno gahapati divā divassa rājagahā nikkhami bhagavantaṁ dassanāya.
analyzed: atha kho sandhānaḥ gahapati divā divassa rājagahā nikkhami bhagavantam dassanāya
translated: Then, in the middle of the day, the householder Sandhāna left Rājagaha to see the Lord.

original: Atha kho sandhānassa gahapatissa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho sandhānassa gahapatissa etat ahosi
translated: And it occurred to him:

original: “akālo kho bhagavantaṁ dassanāya.
analyzed: akālaḥ kho bhagavantam dassanāya
translated: “It is not the right time to see the Lord.

original: Paṭisallīno bhagavā.
analyzed: paṭisallīnaḥ bhagavā
translated: He is in seclusion.

original: Manobhāvanīyānampi bhikkhūnaṁ asamayo dassanāya.
analyzed: manaḥ bhāvanīyānam pi bhikkhūnam asamayaḥ dassanāya
translated: And it is not the right time to see the venerable monks.

original: Paṭisallīnā manobhāvanīyā bhikkhū.
analyzed: paṭisallīnāḥ manaḥ bhāvanīyāḥ bhikkhū
translated: They are in seclusion.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ yena udumbarikāya paribbājakārāmo, yena nigrodho paribbājako tenupasaṅkameyyan”ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham yena udumbarikāya paribbājaka ārāmaḥ yena nigrodhaḥ paribbājako tena upasaṅkameyyanti
translated: Let me go to the Wanderers’ Park of the Single White-lotus Mango Tree to see the wanderer Nigrodha.”

original: Atha kho sandhāno gahapati yena udumbarikāya paribbājakārāmo, tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho sandhānaḥ gahapati yena udumbarikāya paribbājaka ārāmaḥ tena upasaṅkami
translated: He then went to the wanderers’ park of the wanderers of other sects.

original: Tena kho pana samayena nigrodho paribbājako mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṁ nisinno hoti unnādiniyā uccāsaddamahāsaddāya anekavihitaṁ tiracchānakathaṁ kathentiyā.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena nigrodhaḥ paribbājakaḥ mahatiyā paribbājaka parisāya saddhim nisinnaḥ hoti unnādiniyā uccāsadda mahāsaddāya aneka vihitam tiracchāna katham kathentiyā
translated: Now at that time Nigrodha was sitting together with a large assembly of wanderers who were making an uproar, loudly and noisily talking many kinds of pointless talk,

original: Seyyathidaṁ—rājakathaṁ corakathaṁ mahāmattakathaṁ senākathaṁ bhayakathaṁ yuddhakathaṁ🔽annakathaṁ pānakathaṁ vatthakathaṁ sayanakathaṁ mālākathaṁ gandhakathaṁ ñātikathaṁ🔽yānakathaṁ gāmakathaṁ nigamakathaṁ nagarakathaṁ janapadakathaṁ itthikathaṁ sūrakathaṁ
analyzed: seyyathida rāja katham cora katham mahā matta katham senā katham bhaya katham yuddha katha  anna katham pāna katham vattha katham sayana katham mālā katham gandha katham ñāti katha  yāna katham gāma katham nigama katham nagara katham janapada katham itthi katham sūra katha
translated: such as talk of kings, robbers, ministers, armies, dangers, battles,🔽food, drink, clothes, beds, garlands, perfumes, relatives,🔽vehicles, villages, towns and cities, countries, women, heroes,

original: visikhākathaṁ kumbhaṭṭhānakathaṁ pubbapetakathaṁ nānattakathaṁ lokakkhāyikaṁ samuddakkhāyikaṁ🔽itibhavābhavakathaṁ iti vā.
analyzed: visikhā katham kumbhaṭṭhāna katham pubba peta katham nānatta katham lokakkhāyikam samudda kkhāyika  iti bhava abhava katham iti vā
translated: gossip, speculations about the world, speculations about the hells, speculations about the heavens, speculations about the rep-utation of the great man.

original: Addasā kho nigrodho paribbājako sandhānaṁ gahapatiṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.
analyzed: addasā kho nigrodhaḥ paribbājakaḥ sandhānam gahapatim dūratas vā āgacchanta
translated: Nigrodha saw Sandhana coming in the distance,

original: Disvā sakaṁ parisaṁ saṇṭhāpesi:
analyzed: disvā sakam parisam saṇṭhāpesi
translated: and he addressed his own assembly:

original: “appasaddā bhonto hontu, mā bhonto saddamakattha.
analyzed: appasaddāḥ bhonto hontu mā bhonto saddam akattha
translated: “Be quiet, sirs, don’t make any noise.

original: Ayaṁ samaṇassa gotamassa sāvako āgacchati sandhāno gahapati.
analyzed: ayam samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakaḥ āgacchati sandhānaḥ gahapati
translated: Here comes the disciple of the contemplative Gotama, the householder Sandhāna.

original: Yāvatā kho pana samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakā gihī odātavasanā rājagahe paṭivasanti, ayaṁ tesaṁ aññataro sandhāno gahapati.
analyzed: yāvatā kho pana samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakāḥ gihī odāta vasanāḥ rājagahe paṭivasanti ayam tesam aññataraḥ sandhānaḥ gahapati
translated: As far as the contemplative Gotama’s lay disciples in white robes who live in Rājagaha are concerned, he’s one of them.

original: Appasaddakāmā kho panete āyasmanto appasaddavinītā, appasaddassa vaṇṇavādino.
analyzed: appasadda kāmāḥ kho pana ete āyasmantaḥ appasadda vinītāḥ appasaddassa vaṇṇa vādino
translated: But these venerable ones are fond of quietude, are trained in quietude, and speak in praise of quietude.

original: Appeva nāma appasaddaṁ parisaṁ viditvā upasaṅkamitabbaṁ maññeyyā”ti.
analyzed: appā iva nāma appa saddam parisam viditvā upasaṅkamitabbam maññeyya ati
translated: Perhaps, knowing that our assembly is quiet, he will think to approach us.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, te paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
analyzed: evam vutte te paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesu
translated: When this was said, the wanderers fell silent.

original: Atha kho sandhāno gahapati yena nigrodho paribbājako tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā nigrodhena paribbājakena saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho sandhānaḥ gahapati yena nigrodhaḥ paribbājako tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā nigrodhena paribbājakena saddhim sammodi
translated: Then Sandhāna went to Nigrodha and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho sandhāno gahapati nigrodhaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho sandhānaḥ gahapati nigrodham paribbājakam etat avoca
translated: and after an exchange of friendly greetings & courtesies, he sat to one side. As he was sitting there, he said to Nigrodha,

original: “aññathā kho ime bhonto aññatitthiyā paribbājakā saṅgamma samāgamma unnādino uccāsaddamahāsaddā anekavihitaṁ tiracchānakathaṁ anuyuttā viharanti.🔽Seyyathidaṁ—rājakathaṁ …pe… itibhavābhavakathaṁ iti vā.
analyzed: aññathā kho ime bhonto añña titthiyāḥ paribbājakāḥ saṅgamma samāgamma unnādinaḥ uccāsadda mahāsaddāḥ aneka vihitam tiracchāna katham anuyuttāḥ viharanti  iti bhava abhava katham iti vā
translated: “These wanderers of other sects, friends, gather together and, in a great clamor, hold discussion in many ways.🔽That is, discussion about kings, robbers, ministers, armies, dangers, battles, food, drink, clothing, beds, garlands, perfumes, relatives, vehicles, villages, towns & cities, countries, women, heroes, street gossip, gossip about the dead, gossip about the sea—

original: Aññathā kho pana so bhagavā araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevati appasaddāni appanigghosāni vijanavātāni manussarāhasseyyakāni paṭisallānasāruppānī”ti.
analyzed: aññathā kho pana saḥ bhagavā arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevati appa saddāni appa nigghosāni vijana vātāni manussa rāhasseyyakāni paṭisallāna sāruppāni iti
translated: while the Blessed One lives secluded, withdrawn, heedful, ardent, & resolute.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, nigrodho paribbājako sandhānaṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte nigrodhaḥ paribbājakaḥ sandhānam gahapatim etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Nigrodha said to Sandhana,

original: “yagghe, gahapati, jāneyyāsi, kena samaṇo gotamo saddhiṁ sallapati, kena sākacchaṁ samāpajjati, kena paññāveyyattiyaṁ samāpajjati?
analyzed: yat he gahapati jāneyyāsi kena samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ saddhim sallapati kena sākaccham samāpajjati kena paññāveyyattiyam samāpajjati
translated: “Householder, you should know that the contemplative Gotama converses with someone only if he is a wheel-turning monarch.

original: Suññāgārahatā samaṇassa gotamassa paññā aparisāvacaro samaṇo gotamo nālaṁ sallāpāya.
analyzed: suññāgāra hatā samaṇassa gotamassa paññā a parisā avacaraḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ na alam sallāpāya
translated: The wisdom of the contemplative Gotama is destroyed by voidness. The contemplative Gotama is incapable of instructing the people.

original: So antamantāneva sevati.
analyzed: saḥ antam antān eva sevati
translated: He sticks to the fringes.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma gokāṇā pariyantacārinī antamantāneva sevati.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api nāma go kāṇā pariyanta cārinī antam antān eva sevati
translated: Just like a cow with a halter on sticks to the fringes,

original: Evameva suññāgārahatā samaṇassa gotamassa paññā;🔽aparisāvacaro samaṇo gotamo;
analyzed: evam eva suññāgāra hatā samaṇassa gotamassa paññā  a parisā avacaraḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ
translated: so too is the contemplative Gotama’s wisdom destroyed by voidness.

original: nālaṁ sallāpāya.
analyzed: na alam sat lāpāya
translated: The contemplative Gotama is incapable of instructing the people.

original: So antamantāneva sevati.
analyzed: saḥ antam antān eva sevati
translated: He sticks to the fringes.

original: Iṅgha, gahapati, samaṇo gotamo imaṁ parisaṁ āgaccheyya, ekapañheneva naṁ saṁsādeyyāma, tucchakumbhīva naṁ maññe orodheyyāmā”ti.
analyzed: iṅgha gahapati samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ imam parisam āgaccheyya eka pañhena iva nam sasādeyyāma tuccha kumbhī iva nam maññe orodheyyāma ati
translated: Come now, householder, if the contemplative Gotama were to come to this assembly, I would pulverize him with a single question, crush him like a puny blade of grass.

original: Assosi kho bhagavā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya sandhānassa gahapatissa nigrodhena paribbājakena saddhiṁ imaṁ kathāsallāpaṁ.
analyzed: assosi kho bhagavā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkanta mānusikāya sandhānassa gahapatissa nigrodhena paribbājakena saddhim imam kathā sallāpa
translated: With a divine ear, pure and surpassing that of normal humans, the Blessed One heard this conversation between Sandhāna the householder and Nigrodha the wanderer.

original: Atha kho bhagavā gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohitvā yena sumāgadhāya tīre moranivāpo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā sumāgadhāya tīre moranivāpe abbhokāse caṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohitvā yena sumāgadhāya tīre mora nivāpaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā sumāgadhāya tīre mora nivāpe abbhokāse caṅkami
translated: Then, descending from the Vulture Peak, the Blessed One went to the Sumbha Lake at Sumāgadhā. After walking for alms in Sumāgadhā, he went to the Sumbha Lake, where he plunged into the lake and bathed and drank.

original: Addasā kho nigrodho paribbājako bhagavantaṁ sumāgadhāya tīre moranivāpe abbhokāse caṅkamantaṁ.
analyzed: addasā kho nigrodhaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam sumāgadhāya tīre mora nivāpe abbhokāse caṅkamanta
translated: The wanderer Nigrodha saw the Blessed One walking for alms in Sumāgadhā.

original: Disvāna sakaṁ parisaṁ saṇṭhāpesi:
analyzed: disvāna sakam parisam saṇṭhāpesi
translated: Seeing him, he addressed his own assembly:

original: “appasaddā bhonto hontu, mā bhonto saddamakattha, ayaṁ samaṇo gotamo sumāgadhāya tīre moranivāpe abbhokāse caṅkamati.
analyzed: appasaddāḥ bhontaḥ hontu mā bhontaḥ saddam akattha ayam samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sumāgadhāya tīre moranivāpe abbhokāse caṅkamati
translated: “Be quiet, sirs, don’t make any noise. There goes the contemplative Gotama, walking for alms in Sumāgadhā.

original: Appasaddakāmo kho pana so āyasmā, appasaddassa vaṇṇavādī.🔽Appeva nāma appasaddaṁ parisaṁ viditvā upasaṅkamitabbaṁ maññeyya.
analyzed: appasadda kāmaḥ kho pana so āyasmat appasaddassa vaṇṇa vādī  appā iva nāma appa saddam parisam viditvā upasaṅkamitabbam maññeyya
translated: The venerable one likes quiet, commends quiet, and speaks in praise of quiet.🔽Perhaps, if he sees that our assembly is quiet, he will think it worth coming to.

original: Sace samaṇo gotamo imaṁ parisaṁ āgaccheyya, imaṁ taṁ pañhaṁ puccheyyāma:
analyzed: sace samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ imam parisam āgaccheyya imam tam pañham puccheyyāma
translated: If the contemplative Gotama comes to this assembly, we will question him with this question:

original: ‘ko nāma so, bhante, bhagavato dhammo, yena bhagavā sāvake vineti, yena bhagavatā sāvakā vinītā assāsappattā paṭijānanti ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyan’”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nāma saḥ bhante bhagavataḥ dhammaḥ yena bhagavā sāvake vineti yena bhagavatā sāvakāḥ vinītāḥ assāsa pattā paṭijānanti ajjhāsayam ādi brahmacariyanti
translated: ‘What is this teaching of the Buddha, Venerable Sir, through which the Buddha leads his disciples, and through which those disciples who have been led by him declare that they have attained the supreme end of the spiritual life?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, te paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
analyzed: evam vutte te paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesu
translated: When this was said, those wanderers were silent.

original: 2. Tapojigucchāvāda
analyzed: tapaḥ jigucchā vāda
translated: The Teaching of Asceticism

original: Atha kho bhagavā yena nigrodho paribbājako tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā yena nigrodhaḥ paribbājako tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then the Lord approached Nigrodha,

original: Atha kho nigrodho paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho nigrodhaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and Nigrodha said:

original: “etu kho, bhante, bhagavā, svāgataṁ, bhante, bhagavato.
analyzed: etu kho bhante bhagavā svāgata bhante bhagavato
translated: ‘Come, Lord, welcome, Lord!

original: Cirassaṁ kho, bhante, bhagavā imaṁ pariyāyamakāsi yadidaṁ idhāgamanāya.
analyzed: cirassam kho bhante bhagavā imam pariyāyam akāsi yat idam idha āgamanāya
translated: It is long since you found an opportunity to come here.

original: Nisīdatu, bhante, bhagavā, idamāsanaṁ paññattan”ti.
analyzed: nisīdatu bhante bhagavā idam āsanam paññattanti
translated: Sit down, Lord, this seat is ready.’

original: Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane.
analyzed: nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane
translated: The Lord sat down on the prepared seat,

original: Nigrodhopi kho paribbājako aññataraṁ nīcāsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho nigrodhaṁ paribbājakaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: nigrodhaḥ api kho paribbājakaḥ aññataram nīca āsanam gahetvā ekamantam nisīdi 🔽ekamantam nisinnam khalu nigrodham paribbājakam bhagavān etat avoca
translated: and Nigrodha took a low seat and sat down at one side.

original: “kāya nuttha, nigrodha, etarahi kathāya sannisinnā, kā ca pana vo antarākathā vippakatā”ti?
analyzed: kāya nuttha nigrodha etarahi kathāya sannisinnā kā ca pana vaḥ antarākathā vippakatā ati
translated: “Nigrodha, what was the discussion that you were engaged in just now as you were sitting together here? And what was the conversation that was underway?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, nigrodho paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte nigrodhaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Nigrodha the Wanderer said to the Blessed One:

original: “idha mayaṁ, bhante, addasāma bhagavantaṁ sumāgadhāya tīre moranivāpe abbhokāse caṅkamantaṁ, disvāna evaṁ avocumhā:
analyzed: idha bhante addasāma bhagavantam sumāgadhāya tīre moranivāpe abbhokāse caṅkamanta disvāna evam avocumhā
translated: “Just now, venerable sir, we saw the Blessed One walking up and down in the open, and we said:

original: ‘sace samaṇo gotamo imaṁ parisaṁ āgaccheyya, imaṁ taṁ pañhaṁ puccheyyāma:
analyzed: sace samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ imam parisam āgaccheyya imam tam pañham puccheyyāma
translated: ‘If the recluse Gotama were to come to this assembly, we would ask him this question:

original: “ko nāma so, bhante, bhagavato dhammo, yena bhagavā sāvake vineti, yena bhagavatā sāvakā vinītā assāsappattā paṭijānanti ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyan”’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nāma saḥ bhante bhagavataḥ dhammaḥ yena bhagavā sāvake vineti yena bhagavatā sāvakāḥ vinītāḥ assāsa pattā paṭijānanti ajjhāsayam ādi brahmacariyanti
translated: “What, venerable sir, is the Blessed One’s doctrine? What is the Blessed One’s Dispensation? What does the Blessed One teach? What does he proclaim?”’

original: Ayaṁ kho no, bhante, antarākathā vippakatā; atha bhagavā anuppatto”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho naḥ bhante antarākathā vippakatā atha bhagavā anuppatto ti
translated: This was the discussion that was underway, and then the Blessed One arrived.”

original: “Dujjānaṁ kho etaṁ, nigrodha, tayā aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatrāyogena
analyzed: dujjānam kho eta nigrodha tayā añña diṭṭhikena añña khantikena añña rucikena aññatra ayogena
translated: “Nigrodha, it is hard for you, who hold a different view, who are devoted to a different view, who accept a different teacher, and whose way of life is different,

original: aññatrācariyakena, yenāhaṁ sāvake vinemi, yena mayā sāvakā vinītā assāsappattā paṭijānanti
analyzed: aññatra ācariyakena yena aham sāvake vinemi yena mayā sāvakāḥ vinītāḥ assāsa ppattā paṭijānanti
translated: except for my own teachers, by whom I train my disciples, by whom my disciples are trained and acknowledge it.

original: ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyaṁ.
analyzed: ādi brahmacariya
translated: It is the higher virtue of the beginning of the spiritual life.

original: Iṅgha tvaṁ maṁ, nigrodha, sake ācariyake adhijegucche pañhaṁ puccha:
analyzed: iṅgha tvam ma nigrodha sake ācariyake adhijegucche pañham puccha
translated: Come on, Nigrodha, ask me about your own teachers’ jungle-dwellers’ questions:

original: ‘kathaṁ santā nu kho, bhante, tapojigucchā paripuṇṇā hoti, kathaṁ aparipuṇṇā’”ti?
analyzed: katham santā nu kho bhante tapaḥ jigucchā paripuṇṇā hoti katham a paripuṇṇā ati
translated: ‘How is it, Lord, that the ascetics’ jungle-dwellers’ practice is fulfilled, and how is it that it is not fulfilled?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, te paribbājakā unnādino uccāsaddamahāsaddā ahesuṁ:
analyzed: evam vutte te paribbājakāḥ unnādinaḥ uccāsadda mahāsaddāḥ ahesu
translated: At this, the wanderers cried out and made an uproar:

original: “acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, samaṇassa gotamassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā, yatra hi nāma sakavādaṁ ṭhapessati, paravādena pavāressatī”ti.
analyzed: acchariyam vata bho abbhutam vata bho samaṇassa gotamassa mahiddhika tā mahā anubhāva tā yatra hi nāma saka vādam ṭhapessati paravādena pavāressati iti
translated: “It is wonderful, it is marvellous that the ascetic Gotama should overrule his own doctrine and follow that of others!”

original: Atha kho nigrodho paribbājako te paribbājake appasadde katvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho nigrodhaḥ paribbājakaḥ te paribbājake appasadde katvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then Nigrodha, having silenced the wanderers, said to the Lord:

original: “mayaṁ kho, bhante, tapojigucchāvādā tapojigucchāsārā tapojigucchāallīnā viharāma.
analyzed: mayam kho bhante tapaḥ jigucchā vādā tapaḥ jigucchā sārā tapaḥ jigucchā allīnāḥ viharāma
translated: “Lord, we are jungle-dwellers, we value the jungle-dwellers’ practice, we are devoted to it.

original: Kathaṁ santā nu kho, bhante, tapojigucchā paripuṇṇā hoti, kathaṁ aparipuṇṇā”ti?
analyzed: katham santā nu kho bhante tapaḥ jigucchā paripuṇṇā hoti katham a paripuṇṇā ati
translated: “How, venerable sir, is self-mortification and scrupulous austerity fulfilled, and how is it not fulfilled?”

original: “Idha, nigrodha, tapassī acelako hoti muttācāro, hatthāpalekhano, naehibhaddantiko, natiṭṭhabhaddantiko, nābhihaṭaṁ, na uddissakataṁ, na nimantanaṁ sādiyati,
analyzed: idha nigrodha tapassī acelakaḥ hoti mutta ācāraḥ hattha apalekhanaḥ na ehibhaddantikaḥ natiṭṭhabhaddantikaḥ na abhihaṭa na uddissakata na nimantanam sādiyati
translated: “Here, Nigrodha, a self-mortifier is naked, rejecting what is customary, and he behaves in an uncustomary way. He is a counter-irritant,🔽he does not accept food offered by invitation,

original: so na kumbhimukhā paṭiggaṇhāti, na kaḷopimukhā paṭiggaṇhāti, na eḷakamantaraṁ, na🔽daṇḍamantaraṁ, na musalamantaraṁ, na dvinnaṁ bhuñjamānānaṁ, na gabbhiniyā, na pāyamānāya,🔽na purisantaragatāya, na saṅkittīsu, na yattha sā upaṭṭhito hoti, na yattha makkhikā
analyzed: saḥ na kumbhi mukhā paṭiggaṇhāti na kaḷopi mukhā paṭiggaṇhāti na na  na musalam antara na dvinnam bhuñjamānāna na gabbhiniyā na pāyamānāya  na purisa antara gatāya na saṅkittīsu na yattha sā upaṭṭhitaḥ hoti na yattha makkhikā
translated: he does not accept food brought over, nor food cooked specially for him, nor an invitation to a meal,🔽he does not accept honey or oil.🔽He does not receive food from pot to pot, from dish to dish, from bowl to bowl, from hand to hand, nor from mouth to mouth. He does not receive food for the naked ascetics, for the sick, for those who tend the sick, for those on the journey, for those who have arrived, for pregnant women, or for nursing mothers.

original: saṇḍasaṇḍacārinī, na macchaṁ, na maṁsaṁ, na suraṁ, na merayaṁ, na thusodakaṁ pivati,
analyzed: saṇḍasaṇḍacārinī na na maccha na masa na sura na meraya na thusā udakam pivati
translated: He does not receive food given by a woman, by a man and a woman, by a group of men, or by a group of women. He does not receive food given at a place where flies are swarming, nor food given at a place where there are flies and mosquitoes, nor food given at a place where there are flies, mosquitoes, and snakes. He does not receive fish, meat, wine, or fermented liquor.

original: so ekāgāriko vā hoti ekālopiko, dvāgāriko vā hoti dvālopiko, sattāgāriko vā hoti sattālopiko, ekissāpi dattiyā yāpeti, dvīhipi dattīhi yāpeti, sattahipi dattīhi yāpeti;🔽ekāhikampi āhāraṁ āhāreti, dvīhikampi āhāraṁ āhāreti, sattāhikampi āhāraṁ āhāreti, iti evarūpaṁ addhamāsikampi pariyāyabhattabhojanānuyogamanuyutto viharati.🔽So sākabhakkho vā hoti, sāmākabhakkho vā hoti, nīvārabhakkho vā hoti, daddulabhakkho🔽vā hoti, haṭabhakkho vā hoti, kaṇabhakkho vā hoti, ācāmabhakkho vā hoti, piññākabhakkho
analyzed: saḥ ekāgārikaḥ vā hoti ekālopikaḥ dvāgārikaḥ vā hoti dvālopikaḥ sattāgārikaḥ vā hoti sattālopikaḥ ekissā api dattiyā yāpeti dvīhi pi dattīhi yāpeti sattahi pi dattīhi yāpeti  ekāhikam pi āhāram āhāreti dvīhikam pi āhāram āhāreti sattāhikam pi āhāram āhāreti iti evarūpam addhamāsikam pi pariyāya bhatta bhojana anuyogam anuyuttaḥ viharati  so sāka bhakkhaḥ vā hoti sāmāka bhakkhaḥ vā hoti nīvāra bhakkhaḥ vā hoti daddula bhakkhaḥ  vā hoti haṭa bhakkhaḥ vā hoti kaṇa bhakkhaḥ vā hoti ācāma bhakkhaḥ vā hoti piññāka bhakkho
translated: He takes food once a day, once every two days, up to once a week, and so on, even up to once a fortnight.

original: vā hoti, tiṇabhakkho vā hoti, gomayabhakkho vā hoti; vanamūlaphalāhāro yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.
analyzed: vā hoti tiṇa bhakkhaḥ vā hoti gomaya bhakkhaḥ vā hoti vana mūla phala āhāraḥ yāpeti pavatta phala bhojī
translated: He lives off rice bran, or rice-scum, or oil-residue, or millet, or broken rice, or porridge, or coarse food, or rotting grain, or grass, or cow dung. He subsists on forest roots and fruits, eating according to whatever falls to his lot.

original: So sāṇānipi dhāreti, masāṇānipi dhāreti, chavadussānipi dhāreti, paṁsukūlānipi dhāreti,
analyzed: saḥ sāṇāni api dhārā iti masāṇāni api dhārā iti chava dussāni api dhārā iti pasu kūlāni api dhārā iti
translated: He wears robes of sunn hemp, of hemp, of mixed hemp, of animal wool, of human hair, of horse-hair, of Bhesaka leaves, of bark fabric, of antelope hide, of cow hide, of dog hide, of fox hide, of any hide.

original: tirīṭānipi dhāreti, ajinampi dhāreti, ajinakkhipampi dhāreti, kusacīrampi dhāreti,🔽vākacīrampi dhāreti, phalakacīrampi dhāreti, kesakambalampi dhāreti, vāḷakambalampi
analyzed: tirīṭāni api dhārā iti ajinam pi dhārā iti ajinakkhipam pi dhārā iti kusa cīram pi dhārā iti  vāka cīram pi dhārā iti phalaka cīram pi dhārā iti kesa kambalam pi dhārā iti vāḷa kambalam pi
translated: He wears a robe made of bark, he wears a robe made of hemp, he wears a robe made of canvas, he wears a robe made of hair,🔽he wears a robe made of horse-hair, he wears a robe made of black antelope-skin, he wears a robe made of wool, he wears a robe made of (coarse) goat’s hair,🔽

original: dhāreti, ulūkapakkhampi dhāreti,🔽kesamassulocakopi hoti kesamassulocanānuyogamanuyutto,
analyzed: dhāreti ulūka pakkham pi dhāreti  kesa massu locakaḥ api hoti kesa massu locana anuyogam anuyuttaḥ
translated: He wears robes made of hemp, of canvas, of shrouds from a burial ground, of discarded bits of string, of sunn hemp, of Róhita hemp, of bark, of antelope hide, of deer hide, of black antelope hide, of wool, of camel’s hair, of blanket-wool,🔽He plucks out his hair and beard, and devotes himself to this practice.🔽He stands continuously, rejecting seats.

original: ubbhaṭṭhakopi hoti āsanapaṭikkhitto,🔽ukkuṭikopi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānamanuyutto,
analyzed: ubbhaṭṭhakaḥ api hoti āsana paṭikkhittaḥ  ukkuṭikaḥ api hoti ukkuṭika padhānam anuyuttaḥ
translated: He squats continuously, devoted to maintaining that posture.🔽He lies on a mat of thorns, making his bed on a rugged surface.

original: kaṇṭakāpassayikopi hoti kaṇṭakāpassaye seyyaṁ kappeti,🔽phalakaseyyampi kappeti, thaṇḍilaseyyampi kappeti,
analyzed: kaṇṭakāpassayikaḥ api hoti kaṇṭakāpassaye seyyam kappeti  phalaka seyyam pi kappeti thaṇḍila seyyam pi kappeti
translated: He lies on a mat of spikes, making his bed on a rugged surface.

original: ekapassayikopi hoti🔽rajojalladharo,
analyzed: eka passayikaḥ api hoti  rajaḥ jalla dharo
translated: He lies on a board.🔽He wears a dust-smeared robe.

original: abbhokāsikopi hoti
analyzed: abbhokāsikaḥ api hoti
translated: He lives in the open air.

original: yathāsanthatiko,🔽vekaṭikopi hoti vikaṭabhojanānuyogamanuyutto,
analyzed: yathā santhatikaḥ  vekaṭikaḥ api hoti vikaṭa bhojana anuyogam anuyuttaḥ
translated: He sits at the foot of a tree.🔽He eats in one part of the day, not eating at night or in the evening.

original: apānakopi hoti apānakattamanuyutto,
analyzed: apānakaḥ api hoti apānakattam anuyuttaḥ
translated: He eats in one part of the day, not eating at night or in the evening.

original: sāyatatiyakampi udakorohanānuyogamanuyutto viharati.
analyzed: udakorohana anuyogam anuyuttaḥ viharati
translated: He practices bathing in cold water three times a day, even during the winter months when the cold weather is freezing and the snow and hail are falling.

original: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, nigrodha,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi nigrodha
translated: What do you think, Nigrodha?

original: yadi evaṁ sante tapojigucchā paripuṇṇā vā hoti aparipuṇṇā vā”ti?
analyzed: yadi evam sante tapaḥ jigucchā paripuṇṇā vā hoti a paripuṇṇā vā ati
translated: If that’s the case, is the ascetic practice of mortification of self fulfilled or not?”

original: “Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante tapojigucchā paripuṇṇā hoti, no aparipuṇṇā”ti.
analyzed: addhā kho bhante evam sante tapaḥ jigucchā paripuṇṇā hoti no a paripuṇṇā ati
translated: “If that’s the case, Sir, it’s fulfilled, not unfulfilled.”

original: “Evaṁ paripuṇṇāyapi kho ahaṁ, nigrodha, tapojigucchāya anekavihite upakkilese vadāmī”ti.
analyzed: evam kho aha nigrodha tapaḥ jigucchāya aneka vihite upakkilese vadāmi iti
translated: “Nigrodha, I declare that even when the ascetic practice of mortification of self is fulfilled, it has many impurities.”

original: 2.1. Upakkilesa
analyzed: upakkilesa
translated: … Impurities

original: “Yathā kathaṁ pana, bhante, bhagavā evaṁ paripuṇṇāya tapojigucchāya anekavihite upakkilese vadatī”ti?🔽“Idha, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo.
analyzed: yathā katham pana bhante bhagavā evam paripuṇṇāya tapaḥ jigucchāya aneka vihite upakkilese vadati iti  idha nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati saḥ tena tapasā atta manaḥ hoti paripuṇṇa saṅkappaḥ
translated: “But, Sir, how does the Buddha declare that even when the ascetic practice of mortification of self is fulfilled, it has many impurities?”

original: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo.
analyzed: yam pi nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati saḥ tena tapasā atta manaḥ hoti paripuṇṇa saṅkappaḥ
translated: “Nigrodha, take the case of an ascetic who undertakes the practice of mortification of self. He is pleased with it and thinks he has fulfilled his purpose.

original: Ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
analyzed: ayam pi kho nigrodha tapassinaḥ upakkilesaḥ hoti
translated: This is an impurity in that ascetic.

original: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā attānukkaṁseti paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: puna capara nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati saḥ tena tapasā attā anukkaseti param vambheti
translated: Again, an ascetic undertakes the practice of mortification of self. He praises himself and disparages others because of it.

original: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā attānukkaṁseti paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: yam pi nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati saḥ tena tapasā attā anukkaseti param vambheti
translated: And when an ascetic undertakes austerities and then extols himself and disparages others because of those austerities,

original: Ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā majjati mucchati pamādamāpajjati.
analyzed: ayam pi kho nigrodha tapassinaḥ upakkilesaḥ hoti  puna capara nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati saḥ tena tapasā majjati mucchati pamādam āpajjati
translated: this is a corruption of the ascetic practice.🔽“Again, an ascetic undertakes austerities. Because of that he becomes intoxicated and heedless.

original: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā majjati mucchati pamādamāpajjati.
analyzed: yam pi nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati saḥ tena tapasā majjati mucchati pamādam āpajjati
translated: And when an ascetic undertakes austerities and then becomes intoxicated and heedless because of those austerities,

original: Ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo.
analyzed: ayam pi kho nigrodha tapassinaḥ upakkilesaḥ hoti  puna capara nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati saḥ tena tapasā lābha sakkāra silokam abhinibbatteti saḥ tena lābha sakkāra silokena atta manaḥ hoti paripuṇṇa saṅkappaḥ
translated: this is a corruption of the ascetic practice.🔽“Again, an ascetic undertakes austerities. Because of that he generates gain, honor, and renown. He is pleased with that gain, honor, and renown, and his original intention is fulfilled.

original: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo.
analyzed: yam pi nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati saḥ tena tapasā lābha sakkāra silokam abhinibbatteti saḥ tena lābha sakkāra silokena atta manaḥ hoti paripuṇṇa saṅkappaḥ
translated: And when an ascetic undertakes austerities and then generates gain, honor, and renown because of those austerities, and he is pleased with that gain, honor, and renown, and his original intention is fulfilled,

original: Ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
analyzed: ayam pi kho nigrodha tapassinaḥ upakkilesaḥ hoti
translated: This is a defilement of the one who is practicing the holy life.

original: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena attānukkaṁseti paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: puna capara nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati saḥ tena tapasā lābha sakkāra silokam abhinibbattā iti saḥ tena lābha sakkāra silokena attā anukkaseti param vambheti
translated: “Again, a certain one who is practicing the holy life undertakes and practices asceticism. He generates for himself by that asceticism gain, honor, and renown. He becomes intoxicated with that gain, honor, and renown, grows negligent, falls into negligence, and thus fails to attain the unattained, to reach the une reached, to realize the unrealized.🔽This is a defilement of the one who is practicing the holy life.

original: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena attānukkaṁseti paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: yam pi nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati saḥ tena tapasā lābha sakkāra silokam abhinibbattā iti saḥ tena lābha sakkāra silokena attā anukkaseti param vambheti
translated: “Again, a certain one who is practicing the holy life undertakes and practices asceticism. He generates for himself by that asceticism gain, honor, and renown. He becomes intoxicated with that gain, honor, and renown, grows negligent, falls into negligence, and thus fails to attain the unattained, to reach the une reached, to realize the unrealized.

original: Ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
analyzed: ayam pi kho nigrodha tapassinaḥ upakkilesaḥ hoti
translated: This is a defilement of the one who is practicing the holy life.

original: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena majjati mucchati pamādamāpajjati.
analyzed: puna capara nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati saḥ tena tapasā lābha sakkāra silokam abhinibbatteti saḥ tena lābha sakkāra silokena majjati mucchati pamādam āpajjati
translated: “Again, a certain one who is practicing the holy life undertakes and practices asceticism. He generates for himself by that asceticism gain, honor, and renown. He becomes intoxicated with that gain, honor, and renown, grows negligent, falls into negligence, and thus fails to attain the unattained, to reach the une reached, to realize the unrealized.

original: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena majjati mucchati pamādamāpajjati.
analyzed: yam pi nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati saḥ tena tapasā lābha sakkāra silokam abhinibbatteti saḥ tena lābha sakkāra silokena majjati mucchati pamādam āpajjati
translated: And when a mortifier undertakes a practice of mortification for the sake of gain, respect, and praise, he becomes intoxicated by it, grows negligent, falls into negligence.

original: Ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
analyzed: ayam pi kho nigrodha tapassinaḥ upakkilesaḥ hoti
translated: This is a corruption of the mortifier’s practice.

original: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī bhojanesu vodāsaṁ āpajjati:
analyzed: puna capara nigrodha tapassī bhojanesu vodāsam āpajjati
translated: “Again, a mortifier is contemptuous regarding food:

original: ‘idaṁ me khamati, idaṁ me nakkhamatī’ti.🔽So yañca khvassa nakkhamati, taṁ sāpekkho pajahati.
analyzed: idam me khamati idam me na khamati iti  saḥ yat ca khvassa na khamati tam sa apekkhaḥ pajahati
translated: ‘This is allowable for me, this is not allowable for me.’🔽He abandons what is not allowable with expectation.

original: Yaṁ panassa khamati, taṁ gadhito mucchito ajjhāpanno anādīnavadassāvī anissaraṇapañño paribhuñjati …pe…
analyzed: yam pana assa khamati tam gadhitaḥ mucchitaḥ ajjhāpannaḥ anādīnava dassāvī a nissaraṇa pañño paribhuñjati pe
translated: But what is allowable he consumes attached, infatuated, absorbed, greedy, blind to the drawbacks, and not understanding the escape.

original: ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
analyzed: ayam pi kho nigrodha tapassinaḥ upakkilesaḥ hoti
translated: This is a corruption of the mortifier’s practice.

original: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati lābhasakkārasilokanikantihetu:
analyzed: puna capara nigrodha tapassī tapam samādiyati lābha sakkāra siloka nikanti hetu
translated: “Again, a mortifier undertakes a practice of mortification for the sake of gain, respect, and praise:🔽‘Kings, king’s ministers, aristocrats, brahmans, householders, and sectarians will honor me.’ …

original: ‘sakkarissanti maṁ rājāno rājamahāmattā khattiyā brāhmaṇā gahapatikā titthiyā’ti …pe…
analyzed: sakkarissanti mamam rājānaḥ rāja mahāmattāḥ khattiyāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ gahapatikāḥ titthiyāḥ ati pe
translated: ‘Kings, royal ministers, aristocrats, brahmins, householders, and leaders of other schools will respect me.’ …

original: ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
analyzed: ayam pi kho nigrodha tapassinaḥ upakkilesaḥ hoti
translated: This is a defilement for an ascetic.

original: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī aññataraṁ samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā apasādetā hoti:
analyzed: puna capara nigrodha tapassī aññataram samaṇam vā brāhmaṇam vā apasādetā hoti
translated: “Again, Nigrodha, a self-mortifier disparages another ascetic or Brahmin, saying:

original: ‘kiṁ panāyaṁ sambahulājīvo sabbaṁ sambhakkheti.
analyzed: kim pana ayam sambahula ājīvaḥ sabbam sambhakkheti
translated: ‘What is this all-conquering man doing, living like everyone else?

original: Seyyathidaṁ—mūlabījaṁ khandhabījaṁ phaḷubījaṁ aggabījaṁ bījabījameva pañcamaṁ, asanivicakkaṁ dantakūṭaṁ, samaṇappavādenā’ti …pe…
analyzed: seyyathidam mūla bījam khandha bījam phaḷu bījam agga bījam bīja bījam eva pañcama asani vicakkam dantakūṭa samaṇa ppavādena ati pe
translated: Namely, he eats roots, stalks, fruits, and grain of the forest, and he chews tooth-wood and tends his teeth.

original: ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
analyzed: ayam pi kho nigrodha tapassinaḥ upakkilesaḥ hoti
translated: This is a defilement for an ascetic.

original: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī passati aññataraṁ samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā kulesu sakkariyamānaṁ garukariyamānaṁ māniyamānaṁ pūjiyamānaṁ.
analyzed: puna capara nigrodha tapassī passati aññataram samaṇam vā brāhmaṇam vā kulesu sakkariyamānam garukariyamānam māniyamānam pūjiyamāna
translated: “Again, Nigrodha, a self-mortifier sees another ascetic or Brahmin being honoured, respected, revered, and venerated by families.

original: Disvā tassa evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: disvā tassa evam hoti
translated: And he thinks:

original: ‘imañhi nāma sambahulājīvaṁ kulesu sakkaronti garuṁ karonti mānenti pūjenti.
analyzed: imam hi nāma sambahula ājīvam kulesu sakkaronti garum karonti mānenti pūjenti

translated: He recollects his manifold past lives, i.e. one birth, two five, ten fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand, many aeons of world-contraction, many aeons of world-expansion, many aeons of world-contraction and expansion: ‘There I was so named, of such a race, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such the end of my life. translated: ‘These worthy beings who are ill-conducted in body, speech and thought, revilers of Noble Ones, holding wrong views, who undertake actions guided by wrong views, after the break-up of the body, after death, have re-appeared in a state of deprivation, a bad destination, a lower realm, in hell.🔽But these worthy beings who are well-conducted in body, speech and thought, who do not revile Noble Ones, who hold right views, who undertake actions guided by right views, after the break-up of the body, after death, have re-appeared in a good destination, a heavenly world.’

original: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, nigrodha,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi nigrodha
translated: What do you think, Nigrodha?

original: yadi evaṁ sante tapojigucchā parisuddhā vā hoti aparisuddhā vā”ti?
analyzed: yadi evam sante tapaḥ jigucchā parisuddhā vā hoti a parisuddhā vā ati
translated: If this is so, is austerity purified by its fruits or not?”

original: “Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante tapojigucchā parisuddhā hoti no aparisuddhā, aggappattā ca sārappattā cā”ti.
analyzed: addhā kho bhante evam sante tapaḥ jigucchā parisuddhā hoti no a parisuddhā agga ppattā ca sāra ppattā ca ati
translated: “Certainly, Lord, if this is so, austerity is purified by its fruits, it has reached the peak of austerity, it is well proclaimed by the Accomplished One.”

original: “Ettāvatā kho, nigrodha, tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho nigrodha tapaḥ jigucchā agga ppattā ca hoti sāra ppattā ca
translated: “In this way, Nigrodha, austerity reaches its peak and its fruit.

original: Iti kho, nigrodha, yaṁ maṁ tvaṁ avacāsi:
analyzed: iti khaḥ nigrodha yam mama tvam avacāsi
translated: So, Nigrodha, you said:

original: ‘ko nāma so, bhante, bhagavato dhammo, yena bhagavā sāvake vineti, yena bhagavatā sāvakā vinītā assāsappattā paṭijānanti ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyan’ti.
analyzed: kaḥ nāma saḥ bhante bhagavataḥ dhammaḥ yena bhagavā sāvake vineti yena bhagavatā sāvakāḥ vinītāḥ assāsa pattā paṭijānanti ajjhāsayam ādi brahmacariyanti
translated: ‘What, Lord, is that Dhamma of the Lord’s which he teaches the monks, in which the Lord’s monks are trained, and having seen which they claim to have reached certainty, to have attained perfection, to have reached the heart of things, to have attained understanding, to have crossed over doubt, to have reached certainty, to have become free from perplexity, to have attained independence of others in the Teacher’s instruction?’

original: Iti kho taṁ, nigrodha, ṭhānaṁ uttaritarañca paṇītatarañca, yenāhaṁ sāvake vinemi, yena mayā sāvakā vinītā assāsappattā paṭijānanti ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyan”ti.
analyzed: iti kho ta nigrodha ṭhānaṃ uttaritarañca paṇītatarañca yena aham sāvake vinemi yena mayā sāvakāḥ vinītāḥ assāsa pattā paṭijānanti ajjhāsayam ādi brahmacariyanti
translated: So, Nigrodha, there is a higher and more sublime way in which I instruct and teach the disciples, by which instructed and taught, they attain the gratification that is dependent on this present life, and they attain the gratification that is dependent on the future life, and they attain the gratification that is dependent neither on this present life nor on the future life.

original: Evaṁ vutte, te paribbājakā unnādino uccāsaddamahāsaddā ahesuṁ:
analyzed: evam vutte te paribbājakāḥ unnādinaḥ uccāsadda mahāsaddāḥ ahesu
translated: When this was said, those wanderers cried out and wailed and broke out into lamentation.

original: “ettha mayaṁ anassāma sācariyakā, na mayaṁ ito bhiyyo uttaritaraṁ pajānāmā”ti.
analyzed: ettha mayam anassāma sācariyakāḥ na mayam itas bhiyyas uttaritaram pajānāma ati
translated: “Here we are perishing, along with our teacher!”

original: 4. Nigrodhassapajjhāyana
analyzed: nigrodhassa pajjhāyana
translated: The Discussion with Nigrodha

original: Yadā aññāsi sandhāno gahapati:🔽“aññadatthu kho dānime aññatitthiyā paribbājakā bhagavato bhāsitaṁ sussūsanti, sotaṁ odahanti, aññācittaṁ upaṭṭhāpentī”ti.🔽Atha nigrodhaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: yadā aññāsi sandhānaḥ gahapati  aññadatthu kho dāni ime añña titthiyāḥ paribbājakāḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam sussūsanti sotam odahanti aññācittam upaṭṭhāpenti iti  atha nigrodham paribbājakam etat avoca
translated: When the householder Sandhana knew that🔽“these wanderers of other sects are now listening to the Blessed One and are attending closely to his words with eager ears, then he said to the wanderer Nigrodha:

original: “iti kho, bhante nigrodha, yaṁ maṁ tvaṁ avacāsi:
analyzed: iti kho bhante nigrodha yam mama tvam avacāsi
translated: “Venerable sir, you said to me:

original: ‘yagghe, gahapati, jāneyyāsi, kena samaṇo gotamo saddhiṁ sallapati, kena sākacchaṁ samāpajjati, kena paññāveyyattiyaṁ samāpajjati,
analyzed: yat he gahapati jāneyyāsi kena samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ saddhim sallapati kena sākaccham samāpajjati kena paññāveyyattiyam samāpajjati
translated: ‘Householder, you should know that the ascetic Gotama talks with people, converses, and engages in discussion,

original: suññāgārahatā samaṇassa gotamassa paññā, aparisāvacaro samaṇo gotamo nālaṁ sallāpāya, so antamantāneva sevati;
analyzed: suññāgāra hatā samaṇassa gotamassa paññā a parisāvacaraḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ na alam sallāpāya saḥ antam antān eva sevati
translated: that the ascetic Gotama’s wisdom is destroyed by empty dwellings, that the ascetic Gotama is unable to converse, that he just keeps to the wilderness,

original: seyyathāpi nāma gokāṇā pariyantacārinī antamantāneva sevati.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api nāma go kāṇā pariyanta cārinī antam antān eva sevati
translated: just like a cowherd who just keeps to the wilderness.

original: Evameva suññāgārahatā samaṇassa gotamassa paññā, aparisāvacaro samaṇo gotamo nālaṁ sallāpāya; so antamantāneva sevati;
analyzed: evam eva suññāgāra hatā samaṇassa gotamassa paññā a parisā avacaraḥ samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ na alam sallāpāya saḥ antam antān eva sevati
translated: In the same way, the ascetic Gotama’s wisdom is destroyed by empty dwellings, that the ascetic Gotama is unable to converse, that he just keeps to the wilderness;

original: iṅgha, gahapati, samaṇo gotamo imaṁ parisaṁ āgaccheyya, ekapañheneva naṁ saṁsādeyyāma, tucchakumbhīva naṁ maññe orodheyyāmā’ti.
analyzed: iṅgha gahapati samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ imam parisam āgaccheyya eka pañhena iva nam sasādeyyāma tuccha kumbhī iva nam maññe orodheyyāma ati
translated: come now, householder, if the ascetic Gotama were to come to this assembly, I would smash him with just one question, I would knock him down like an empty pot.’

original: Ayaṁ kho so, bhante, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho idhānuppatto, aparisāvacaraṁ pana
analyzed: ayam kho saḥ bhante bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ idha anuppattaḥ a parisā avacaram pana
translated: This is the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha who has arrived here, but he does not keep to assemblies,🔽but he is able to converse,

original: naṁ karotha, gokāṇaṁ pariyantacāriniṁ karotha, ekapañheneva naṁ saṁsādetha, tucchakumbhīva naṁ orodhethā”ti.
analyzed: nam karotha go kāṇam pariyanta cārinim karotha eka pañhena iva nam sasādetha tuccha kumbhī iva nam orodhetha ati
translated: Make him a one-eyed cow-herder who walks along the edge of a cliff. With just one question, you should make him fall into an abyss, like an empty pot is submerged.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, nigrodho paribbājako tuṇhībhūto maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdi.
analyzed: evam vutte nigrodhaḥ paribbājakaḥ tuṇhībhūtaḥ maṅku bhūtaḥ patta kkhandhaḥ adhomukhaḥ pajjhāyantaḥ appaṭibhānaḥ nisīdi
translated: When this was said, Nigrodha sat silent, dismayed, shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say.

original: Atha kho bhagavā nigrodhaṁ paribbājakaṁ tuṇhībhūtaṁ maṅkubhūtaṁ pattakkhandhaṁ adhomukhaṁ pajjhāyantaṁ appaṭibhānaṁ viditvā nigrodhaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā nigrodham paribbājakam tuṇhībhūtam maṅku bhūtam patta kkhandham adhomukham pajjhāyantam appaṭibhānam viditvā nigrodham paribbājakam etat avoca
translated: Then, knowing that Nigrodha was silent, dismayed, shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say, the Buddha said to him:

original: “saccaṁ kira, nigrodha, bhāsitā te esā vācā”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira nigrodha bhāsitā te esā vācā ati
translated: “Is it true, Nigrodha, that you said this?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhante, bhāsitā me esā vācā, yathābālena yathāmūḷhena yathāakusalenā”ti.
analyzed: sat ca bhante bhāsitā me esā vācā yathā bālena yathā mūḍhena yathā akusalena ati
translated: “Yes, Sir, I said it, like a fool, confused and inexperienced.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, nigrodha.
analyzed: tam kim maññasi nigrodha
translated: “What do you think, Nigrodha?

original: Kinti te sutaṁ paribbājakānaṁ vuḍḍhānaṁ mahallakānaṁ ācariyapācariyānaṁ bhāsamānānaṁ:
analyzed: kinti te sutam paribbājakānam vuḍḍhānam mahallakānam ācariya pācariyānam bhāsamānānam
translated: What have you heard said by the brahmins who are senior, of long standing, the teachers of the teachers?

original: ‘ye te ahesuṁ atītamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, evaṁ su te bhagavanto saṅgamma samāgamma unnādino uccāsaddamahāsaddā anekavihitaṁ tiracchānakathaṁ anuyuttā viharanti.
analyzed: ye te ahesum atītam addhānam arahantaḥ sammāsambuddhāḥ evam su te bhagavantaḥ saṅgamma samāgamma unnādinaḥ uccāsadda mahāsaddāḥ aneka vihitam tiracchāna katham anuyuttāḥ viharanti
translated: ‘Those who were fully awakened Buddhas in the past, they too, after going forth, would gather together and make an uproar, a great commotion, and engage in all kinds of pointless talk,

original: Seyyathidaṁ—rājakathaṁ corakathaṁ …pe… itibhavābhavakathaṁ iti vā.
analyzed: cora katham iti vā
translated: such as talk about kings, warriors, and ministers, about enemies and about friends, about clothes, food, bedding, garlands, perfumes, relatives, vehicles, villages, towns, cities, countries, women, heroes, street gossip, gossip about the dead, and about various humors, or else talk about being fortunate, unfortunate, or about how the world might be destroyed.

original: Seyyathāpi tvaṁ etarahi sācariyako.🔽Udāhu, evaṁ su te bhagavanto araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti appasaddāni
analyzed: sā iyyathā api tvam etarahi sācariyakaḥ  udāhu evam su te bhagavantaḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti appasaddāni
translated: Just like you and your teachers.

original: appanigghosāni vijanavātāni manussarāhasseyyakāni paṭisallānasāruppāni, seyyathāpāhaṁ etarahī’”ti.
analyzed: appa nigghosāni vijana vātāni manussa rāhasseyyakāni paṭisallāna sāruppāni seyyathā apa aham etarahi iti
translated: Or did those Buddhas go to live in the wilderness, in remote lodgings in the forest, in the depths of the jungle, far from the madding crowd, quiet and undisturbed, where there is little sound, little noise, that is secluded and fitting for seclusion, just as I do now?’”

original: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante. Paribbājakānaṁ vuḍḍhānaṁ mahallakānaṁ ācariyapācariyānaṁ bhāsamānānaṁ:
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante paribbājakānam vuḍḍhānam mahallakānam ācariya pācariyānam bhāsamānānam
translated: “I’ve heard that, Sir, from wandering ascetics who are old, senior, advanced in years, who are teachers and teachers’ teachers.

original: ‘ye te ahesuṁ atītamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, na evaṁ su te bhagavanto saṅgamma samāgamma unnādino uccāsaddamahāsaddā anekavihitaṁ tiracchānakathaṁ anuyuttā viharanti.
analyzed: ye te ahesum atītam addhānam arahantaḥ sammāsambuddhāḥ na evam su te bhagavantaḥ saṅgamma samāgamma unnādinaḥ uccāsadda mahāsaddāḥ aneka vihitam tiracchāna katham anuyuttāḥ viharanti
translated: ‘Those who were perfected ones in the past taught the Dhamma with a loud voice, with a great deal of noise and commotion, and they were devoted to all kinds of pointless talk.

original: Seyyathidaṁ—rājakathaṁ corakathaṁ …pe… itibhavābhavakathaṁ iti vā,
analyzed: cora katham iti vā
translated: Such as talk about kings, … and talk about spirits.

original: seyyathāpāhaṁ etarahi sācariyako.🔽Evaṁ su te bhagavanto araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti appasaddāni
analyzed: sā iyyathā apa aham etarahi sācariyakaḥ  evam su te bhagavantaḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti appasaddāni
translated: Just like me and my teachers.

original: appanigghosāni vijanavātāni manussarāhasseyyakāni paṭisallānasāruppāni, seyyathāpi
analyzed: appa nigghosāni vijana vātāni manussa rāhasseyyakāni paṭisallāna sāruppāni seyyathā api
translated: But those who were perfected ones in the past used to stay in remote lodgings, in the wilderness and remote jungle-thicket lodgings, which are quiet and still, far from the madding crowd, and undisturbed by people. They were suitable for seclusion,

original: bhagavā etarahī’”ti.
analyzed: bhagavān etarahi iti
translated: just like the Buddha does now.’“

original: “Tassa te, nigrodha, viññussa sato mahallakassa na etadahosi:🔽‘buddho so bhagavā bodhāya dhammaṁ deseti, danto so bhagavā damathāya dhammaṁ deseti,
analyzed: tassa te nigrodha viññussa sataḥ mahallakassa naḥ etat ahosi  buddhaḥ saḥ bhagavā bodhāya dhammam deseti dantaḥ saḥ bhagavā damathāya dhammam deseti
translated: “Nigrodha, you were sensible, mature, and elderly. It never occurred to you🔽that the Buddha teaches the Dhamma for the sake of awakening, that the Buddha teaches the Dhamma for the sake of self-control,

original: santo so bhagavā samathāya dhammaṁ deseti, tiṇṇo so bhagavā taraṇāya dhammaṁ deseti,
analyzed: santaḥ saḥ bhagavā samathāya dhammam deseti tiṇṇaḥ saḥ bhagavā taraṇāya dhammam deseti
translated: that the Buddha teaches the Dhamma for the sake of peace, that the Buddha teaches the Dhamma for the sake of complete understanding,

original: parinibbuto so bhagavā parinibbānāya dhammaṁ desetī’”ti?
analyzed: parinibbutaḥ saḥ bhagavā parinibbānāya dhammam deseti iti
translated: that the Buddha has attained final Nibbana, and that he teaches the Dhamma for attaining final Nibbana?”

original: 5. Brahmacariyapariyosānasacchikiriyā
analyzed: brahmacariya pariyosāna sacchikiriyā
translated: The Realization of the Climax of the Spiritual Life

original: Evaṁ vutte, nigrodho paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte nigrodhaḥ paribbājakaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the wanderer Nigrodha said to the Blessed One:

original: “accayo maṁ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṁ yathāmūḷhaṁ yathāakusalaṁ, yvāhaṁ evaṁ bhagavantaṁ avacāsiṁ.
analyzed: accayaḥ ma bhante accagamāḥ yathābālam yathāmūḍham yathā akusala yvā aham evam bhagavantam avacāsi
translated: “Venerable sir, I have made a mistake. It was foolish, stupid, and wrong of me to say that about the Blessed One.

original: Tassa me, bhante, bhagavā accayaṁ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu āyatiṁ saṁvarāyā”ti.
